subject: p15094735
History: Status post CABG with dyspnea. Evaluate for edema.
Findings: A right internal jugular hemodialysis catheter ends in the right atrium. The size of the cardiac silhouette is at the upper limits of normal. Sternal wires are intact. A moderate right pleural effusion is slightly bigger. There has been slight increase in the pulmonary edema. Opacification at the right base persists and may be a pneumonia. There is no pneumothorax.
Impression: Increasing pulmonary edema and enlargement of the moderate right pleural effusion. Possible right lower lobe pneumonia is unchanged.
